ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I tend to get happy very easily
Notes: 1 = Very unlike me; 2 = Somewhat unlike me; 3 = Neither like or unlike me; 4 = Somewhat like me; 5 = Very like me

ElementDescription: I tend to get upset very easily
Notes: 1 = Very unlike me; 2 = Somewhat unlike me; 3 = Neither like or unlike me; 4 = Somewhat like me; 5 = Very like me

ElementDescription: When I'm happy, the feeling stays with me for quite a while
Notes: 1 = Very unlike me; 2 = Somewhat unlike me; 3 = Neither like or unlike me; 4 = Somewhat like me; 5 = Very like me

ElementDescription: When I'm upset, it takes me quite a while to snap out of it
Notes: 1 = Very unlike me; 2 = Somewhat unlike me; 3 = Neither like or unlike me; 4 = Somewhat like me; 5 = Very like me

ElementDescription: I think I experience happiness more intensely than my friends
Notes: 1 = Very unlike me; 2 = Somewhat unlike me; 3 = Neither like or unlike me; 4 = Somewhat like me; 5 = Very like me

ElementDescription: If I'm upset, I feel it more intensely than everyone else
Notes: 1 = Very unlike me; 2 = Somewhat unlike me; 3 = Neither like or unlike me; 4 = Somewhat like me; 5 = Very like me

ElementDescription: My emotions go automatically from neutral to positive

ElementDescription: It takes me longer than other people to get over an anger episode

ElementDescription: Negative-activation score
Notes: Sum of items: 2, 8, 14, 20, and 26

ElementDescription: Negative-intensity score
Notes: Sum of items: 6, 12, 18, 24, and 30

ElementDescription: Negative-duration score
Notes: Sum of items: 4, 10, 16, 22, and 28

ElementDescription: Positive-activation score
Notes: Sum of items: 1, 7, 13, 19, and 25

ElementDescription: Positive-intensity score
Notes: Sum of items: 5, 11, 17, 23, and 29

ElementDescription: Positive-duration score
Notes: Sum of items: 3, 9, 15, 21, and 27

ElementDescription: General negative reactivity score
Notes: Sum of all even numbered items

ElementDescription: General positive reactivity score
Notes: Sum of all odd numbered items

ElementDescription: Perth Emotional Reactivity Scale-Short Form (PERS-S): General Negative Reactivity Composite Score
Perth Emotional Reactivity Scale-Short Form (PERS-S): General Positive Reactivity Composite Score
Timepoint/visit label
